Description: Refers to the specific taxonomic level for which the equation was developed (species, genus, family or plant group)

Maximun DBH in cm sampled to develop the equation

Mass unit used in original publication

Method used to develop the allometry. Traditionally, this is done by harvesting whole trees, drying, and weighing ("harvest").  However, we anticipate that many future allometries will be developed using ground-based LiDAR ("lidar").
Parameters included in model (H: tree height (m); DBH: diameter breast heigh (1.3 m); DBA: diameter at base; WD: wood density)

Description: Indicates if a correction factor (CF) or a relative standard error (RSE) was included in model
